thread.title: Dallas Cowboy Says He Was Kicked Off American Airlines Flight
thread.title_full: Dallas Cowboy Says He Was Kicked Off American Airlines Flight

author: CBS Dallas / Fort Worth
title: Dallas Cowboy Says He Was Kicked Off American Airlines Flight

organizations.name: dallas cowboy says he was kicked off american airlines

text:
Follow The Fan: Facebook | Twitter 
DALLAS (105.3 The Fan) ‚Äì Dallas Cowboys defensive tackle Tyrone Crawford said on twitter that he got kicked off an American Airlines flight on Thursday (he later deleted the tweet). 
Speaking to the Ben and Skin Show on 105.3 The Fan after the incident, Crawford said that he was sitting in an exit row when he was asked by a flight attendant to check his bag because it was over an inch too big. 
Crawford said his carry-on bag is expensive and didn‚Äôt want to check it, so he decided to wait for a manager to determine if he didn‚Äôt have to check the bag. When a manager never appeared, Crawford said he had the bag checked because he didn‚Äôt want to delay everyone on the plane. 
The defensive tackle said he called the employee a ‚Äúbum‚Äù for not letting him keep the bag on the plane and refused to move out of the flight attendant‚Äôs way for what he called ‚Äúa minute.‚Äù 
Crawford was then asked to come to the front of the plane, where he was removed. 
Crawford told Ben and Skin that people on the plane booed the employee when he was asked to leave. 
American Airlines has replied to Crawford on twitter and says they would like to look into what happened. @TCrawford98 We'd like to look into what happened. Please DM your record locator and share more of what happened. 
‚Äî American Airlines (@AmericanAir) February 16, 2017 
Crawford, who‚Äôs from Canada, said he was returning to Windsor to visit family and watch his cousin compete in a sporting event. It's ok y'all are still my favorite airline y'all got me on the next flight out S/O @AmericanAir https://t.co/lOp3UVP91i 
‚Äî Tyrone Crawford üá®üá¶ (@TCrawford98) February 16, 2017 
Crawford later responded and said American Airlines is still his favorite airline and that they got him on the next flight out. American then replied by saying that they were ‚Äúglad all is good.‚Äù @TCrawford98 Whew! We're glad all is good, you know you're one of our favs too. Follow us and send a DM, we just have a quick question. 
‚Äî American Airlines (@AmericanAir) February 16, 2017
